pullRequest.body:
For `G` a commutative monoid and a set `A` in `G × G` , define corners of `A` as solutions to `x₁ + y₂ = x₂ + y₁` where `(x₁, y₁) ∈ A, (x₁, y₂) ∈ A, (x₂, y₁) ∈ A`.

Define corner-free sets as sets containing no non-trivial corners.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
> As a side note, I had recently formalised results related to corner-free sets for [my project](https://github.com/grhkm21/LeanCornerFree/blob/master/BenGreenCornerFree/Defs.lean#L23), so I can edit my proofs to use this definition, then maybe it can go into Mathlib too, just like Behrend's construction?

Yes absolutely! In fact, as mentioned on Xena, I was going to make Ben Green's construction part of an upcoming project to formalise the last section of my Part III essay. Hence adding it to mathlib would be very topical.

![image](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/assets/83517584/1d5cca0f-fe19-4c70-9150-7a835624f052)

Is this saying that `@[simp]` lemmas shouldn't be provable by `simp` already? Seems weird (?)
Yes, that's right. This is to make sure all simp lemmas get a chance to fire in at least one situation.
What do I do now?
I've sent a message on the (private) reviewers stream.

Thanks!

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9196627360/job/25295153313)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9196627360/job/25295153555)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9196627360/job/25295152669)
Looks good to me

Small edits, but the definition looks good to me.

As a side note, I had recently formalised results related to corner-free sets for [my project](https://github.com/grhkm21/LeanCornerFree/blob/master/BenGreenCornerFree/Defs.lean#L23), so I can edit my proofs to use this definition, then maybe it can go into Mathlib too, just like Behrend's construction?
Looks good to me
Singleton is also corner-free.

```suggestion
/-- A **corner** of a set `A` in a commutative monoid is a triple of points of the form
```

There's one more below.
I meant that as a "convenient lie", but maybe it is just confusing?
Ohh I thought it's just a mistake. I don't think it's confusing, maybe it's okay to leave it as it is. You can decide
Actually I maintain my current phrasing because the sentence says `(x, y), (x + d, y), (x, y + d)` (which is the usual definition), and this is the correct definition only in abelian groups.
Is this missing a comma?

Oh it should be
```suggestion
property of being corner-free.
```
The corners theorem and Roth's theorem will live in another file. See #9000.
Should there be a lemma to show that your definition is equivalent to this in a group?
It's not actually that useful in practice but I can certainly provide the lemma.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Corners, corner-free sets

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Corners theorem, Roth's theorem
